alert.note: Alert for Leslie; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 2:20PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Leslie and southeastern Perry Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 220 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Stinnett, or near Hyden, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Hyden, Wendover and Chappell around 225 PM EDT. Cinda, Cutshin, Smilax, Causey, Big Fork and Wooton around 235 PM EDT. Daley, Yeaddiss and Frew around 240 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Big Rock, Leatherwood, Slemp, Daisy, Viper, Cornettsville, Jeff and Delphia. THIS INCLUDES Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 39 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southeastern Kentucky.
